date.title: [yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.ssssss] UTC date file created
date.description: The UTC date and time when the HDU was created, in the form YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssss, where YYYY shall be the four-digit calendar year number, MM the two-digit month number with January given by 01 and December by 12, and DD the two-digit day of the month. The literal T shall separate the date and time, hh shall be the two-digit hour in the day, mm the two-digit number of minutes after the hour, and ss.ssssss the number of seconds (two digits followed by a fraction accurate to microseconds) after the minute. Default values must not be given to any portion of the date/time string, and leading zeros must not be omitted.
date.calculation: Operating system time in the format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.ssssss

origin.title: institution responsible for creating FITS file
origin.description: Identifies the organization or institution responsible for creating the FITS file.

time_sys.title: principal time system for time-related keywords
time_sys.description: Principal time system for time-related keywords. Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) will be used.

filename.title: Name of the file
filename.description:
Name of the file.

Exposure-based science product file names are expressed as jwpppppooovvv_ggsaa_eeeee_detector_prod.fits, where:

  • ppppp - Program Number
  • ooo - Observation Number
  • vvv - Visit Number
  • gg - Visit Group
  • s - Parallel Sequence id (1 prime, 2-5 parallel)
  • aa - Activity (base 36)
  • eeeee - Exposure Number
  • detector - Detector name
  • prod - Product type designation (Ex: rate, uncal, cal)

Source-based science product file names are expressed as jwppppp_target_instrument_opticalelement_prod.fits, where:

  • ppppp - Program number
  • target - Target ID
  • instrument - Instrument name
  • opticalelement - List of filter/grating names
  • Product type designation (Ex: rate, uncal, cal)
filename.calculation: Created in the Science Data Processing (SDP) by concatenating the identifiers found in the ScienceImageHeader
filename.source: Science Data Processing (SDP) or Calibration Software

filetype.title: Type of data in the file
filetype.description: Type of data found in file: original, uncalibrated, slope-fit, calibrated, etc.
filetype.source: Science Data Processing (SDP) or Calibration Software

data_processing_software_version.title: data processing software version number
data_processing_software_version.description: Version number of the data processing software

prd_software_version.title: S&OC PRD version number used in data processing
prd_software_version.description: S&OC Project Reference Database (S&OC PRD) version number used in data processing
prd_software_version.source: Science and Operations Center Project Reference Database (PRD)

telescope.title: telescope used to acquire the data
telescope.description: A character string identifying the telescope used to acquire the data associated with the header: JWST.

hga_move.title: High Gain Antenna moved during data collection
hga_move.description: High Gain Antenna moved during data collection

model_type.title: Type of data model
model_type.description: The DATAMODL keyword records the name of the calibration pipeline software data model class to be used when loading/accessing the data in the FITS file.

pwfseet.title: [d] previous WFS exposure end time in MJD
pwfseet.description: Exposure end time from the previous WFS exposure (Modified Julian Date)

nwfsest.title: [d] next WFS exposure start time in MJD
nwfsest.description: Exposure start time from the next WFS exposure (Modified Julian Date)

bitpix_sci_image.title: bits per data value
bitpix_sci_image.description: The value field shall contain an integer that specifies the number of bits that represent a data value in the associated data array. BITPIX = 0 for the primary header. For an image extension, 16 is uncalibrated and -32 is calibrated. For group information captured in an ASCI_EXTI table extension BITPIX = 8, denoting that the array contains ASCI_EXTI characters.

naxis_sci_image.title: Number of axes
naxis_sci_image.description: The value field shall contain a non-negative integer no greater than 999, representing the number of axes in the associated data array. A value of zero signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU.  In the context of FITS 'TABLE' or 'BINTABLE' extensions, the value of NAXIS is always 2.

naxis1_sci_image.title: Size of the axis
naxis1_sci_image.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer, representing the number of elements along axis n of a data array.  The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,...,NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

naxis2_sci_image.title: Size of the axis
naxis2_sci_image.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer, representing the number of elements along axis n of a data array.  The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,...,NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

naxis3_sci_image.title: Size of the axis
naxis3_sci_image.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer, representing the number of elements along axis n of a data array.  The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,...,NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

naxis4_sci_image.title: Size of the axis
naxis4_sci_image.description: The value field of this indexed keyword shall contain a non-negative integer, representing the number of elements along axis n of a data array.  The NAXISn must be present for all values n = 1,...,NAXIS, and for no other values of n. A value of zero for any of the NAXISn signifies that no data follow the header in the HDU. If NAXIS is equal to 0, there should not be any NAXISn keywords.

pcount_sci_image.title: number of parameter bytes following data table
pcount_sci_image.description: The value field shall contain an integer that shall be used in any way appropriate to define the data structure. In IMAGE extensions this keyword must have the value 0.

bscale_sci_image.title: scale factor for array value to physical value
bscale_sci_image.description: scale factor for array value to physical value

bzero_sci_image.title: physical value for an array value of zero
bzero_sci_image.description: physical value for an array value of zero

bunit_sci_image.title: physical units of the data array values
bunit_sci_image.description: physical units of the data array values

sci_extension_sci_image.title: EXTNAME of the extension containing image
sci_extension_sci_image.description: EXTNAME of the extension containing data quality mask.

bitpix_groupdq_image.title: bits per data value
bitpix_groupdq_image.description: The value field shall contain an integer that specifies the number of bits that represent a data value in the associated data array. BITPIX = 0 for the primary header. For an image extension, 16 is uncalibrated and -32 is calibrated. For group information captured in an AGROUPDQI table extension BITPIX = 8, denoting that the array contains AGROUPDQI characters.

pcount_groupdq_image.description: The value field shall contain an integer that shall be used in any way appropriate to define the data structure. In IMAGE extensions this keyword must have the value 0.

extname_groupdq_image.title: EXTNAME of the extension containing image
extname_groupdq_image.description: EXTNAME of the extension containing data quality mask.
